page.title: 11RECREATION
page.content: Cricket. Cricket has been played at Appley for over a hundred years. Until recently it was the main event each week for most local people between April and September. Now the age of the cricketers is increasing as fewer young people seem interested in playing. The area has produced some very good players and some have been chosen to go for County trials. The local team play against others from as far away as Taunton and Allerford. After a match at the cricket field the teams and their families often go to the Globe Inn for refreshment. It becomes very busy. The Ashbrittle and Stawley Cricket Club are such a good team that they are in the top division of the West Somerset League.
